description: cartoonish anthopomorphized toad; standing, with bow legs, with PL arm outstretched and foreshortened, smiling; wearing jacket and vest, knickers and shoes
provenance: John E. Andrus III (Wayzata, Minn.); Julie Andrus (Minneapolis, Minn.)
text: This dapper, bespectacled toad wears a cutaway morning coat, vest, and shirt. His trousers are short, perhaps rolled up to avoid the morning dew. He reaches out in a gesture of warm greeting and offers a toothless smile. Could he be Mr. Toad from The Wind in the Willows' Or, Toad of Toad Hall' We wish we knew who made this charming lithograph.
title: Toad (Toad of Toad Hall?)
